#summary The SVG <ellipse> element represents an ellipse.
You are here: [Welcome Home] > [SVGElements SVG Elements] > *ellipse element*

= Introduction =

The ellipse element is used to create an ellipse (oval).

= Details =
== Usage ==

{{{
<ellipse cx="100" cy="100" rx="50" ry="30" fill="blue" stroke="yellow" />
}}}

== Attributes ==

Common attributes:

  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/shapes.html#EllipseeElementCXAttribute cx] - the x-coordinate of the center of the ellipse
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/shapes.html#EllipseElementCYAttribute cy] - the y-coordinate of the center of the ellipse
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/shapes.html#EllipseElementRXAttribute rx] - the x-radius of the ellipse
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/shapes.html#EllipseElementRYAttribute ry] - the y-radius of the ellipse
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/painting.html#FillProperty fill] - describes how the interior of the ellipse should be painted, see [SVGFillProperties].  The default value is "black".
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/painting.html#StrokeProperty stroke] - describes how the outline of the ellipse should be painted, see [SVGStrokeProperties]. The default value is "none".


= Reference =

  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/shapes.html#EllipseeElement The <ellipse> element in SVG 1.1]
